comments.author: Abu Jamal
comments.content:
What a delight it is to read your post Sir. I can so relate to so many of the surprises and mishaps (and some rash descisions) that happened to you during your trip. I would still like to make a few points for your future reference:

1. Never go to sleep immediately after ascending to a high altitude. Although your body will dictate you otherwise, but stay awake for at least 3 – 4 hours so that your body can acclamatize to the height. The body is not used to the low oxygen in the the air at such altitude and ITS intake gets even lower while sleeping, which could even result in death.

2. Never trek at night unless you are trained for it.

3. 80% of trekking/mountaineering accidents happen while descending, so never tire yourself to a point where you can’t control where you’re going.

It was wonderful reading your story. You have surely made my day.
